reasoning: Sporadic cerebral amyloid angiopathy (sCAA) is a cerebrovascular disease. Reported incidence of intracerebral hemorrhage from sCAA is approximately 1-2 per 100k person-years. Prevalence in elderly populations is estimated at 20-30 per 100k based on autopsy and neuroimaging studies. Using middle estimate of 25 per 100k.
source: Greenberg SM et al. (2009). Cerebral amyloid angiopathy and Alzheimer disease--one peptide, two pathways. Nat Rev Neurol. 5(11):611-622
